items.title: Kotak Bank shares in focus after CCI approves acquisition of Standard Chartered's personal loan book
items.description: The acquired loans are categorised as standard assets, further aligning with Kotak Mahindra Bank's plan to accelerate growth and expand its market share

items.description: Check out the latest brokerage calls and analyst comments on the stocks in action today. Our coverage includes Siemens, LTIMindtree, M&M and more.

items.description: The extended partnership aims to drive Marelli’s cloud transformation while enhancing operational efficiency

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Gift Nifty suggests flat to positive start; US markets gain, Asia trades lower
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates:  Wall Street stocks, led by S&P 500 and the Nasdaq, ended higher on Tuesday, as technology stocks rebounded, while investors digested President-elect Donald Trump's tariff pledges on top trade partners and the latest minutes from the Federal Reserve. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 123.74 points, or 0.28%, to 44,860.31, the S&P 500 gained 34.26 points, or 0.57%, to 6,021.63 and the Nasdaq Composite gained 119.46 points, or 0.63%, to 19,174.30.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The GIFT Nifty is indicating a flat to positive opening for the day.

items.title: Live: Nifty Poised To Edge Higher As FIIs Remain Net Buyers| NTPC Green Lists Today| Opening Bell
items.description: Indian equity market broke a two-day rally to end marginally lower in a volatile session. The Nifty ended below the 24,200 mark. Despite mixed global cues, the Indian indices opened higher with Nifty above 24,300, but erased all the gains in the first hour and traded in red zone for most part of the day. However, final hour buying helped indices recover from day's low. Britannia Industries, Asian Paints, Shriram Finance, Bharat Electronics, Infosys are among the top gainers on the Nifty, while losers are Adani Enterprises, Adani Ports, UltraTech Cement, Sun Pharma and Bajaj Auto. This morning global cues are mixed. M&M, Vedanta and Siemens are among stocks to watch today. NTPC Green lists on the exchanges. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Rajesh Palviya, Senior Vice President Research (Head Technical & Derivatives ) at Axis Securities and Nirav R Karkera, Head of Research, Fisdom

items.title: Morgan Stanley downgrades Prestige Estates to 'underweight'; foresees 11.5% downside
items.description: Morgan Stanley's rating downgrade on Prestige Estates was attributed to the company's high IP business capex and weaker pre-sales momentum compared to peers.

items.title: Ola Electric shares zoom 9% on new Gig, S1 Z range of scooters; Citi gives 'buy' rating
items.description: The new Gig range is designed specifically for gig workers, offering two variants — 'Gig' and 'Gig+' — priced at Rs 39,999 and Rs 49,999 (ex-showroom), respectively.

items.title: Agri Picks Report November 27, 2024: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit, Farmers in Gujarat have sown rabi crops across 1.2 million hectares as of Monday, down 42.5% on year from 2.0 million hectares sown in the same period last year, according to a report released by the state agriculture department.

items.title: Nifty, Sensex open flat as FMCG, realty stocks drag; Auto, IT lend support
items.description: FMCG stocks witnessed profit booking after shares rallied in the previous session. Market experts suggest weakness in consumption and see limited upside for the FMCG space in the near term.

items.title: Aster DM stock soars 5% on plans to acquire remaining stake in Aster Aadhar Hospital
items.description: The complete acquisition of Aster Aadhar Hospital will further Aster DM Healthcare's plan to take its total bed capacity to 6,800 beds by FY27.

items.title: M&M shares rise 3% on new 'Born Electric' SUV launch, Morgan Stanley issues 'overweight' call
items.description: Morgan Stanley added that the newly launched BE 6e and XEV 9e electric SUVs are priced in line with the premium variants.

items.title: Brokerages mixed on LTIMindtree as it outlines revenue target of $10 billion by FY31-32
items.description: While the projection underscores LTIMindtree's long-term vision, brokerages remained cautious, flagging ongoing challenges in discretionary spending that could weigh on near-term growth

items.title: Morgan Stanley, JPMorgan initiate 'overweight' calls on Hyundai India, foresee 29% upside
items.description: While Morgan Stanley anticipates 29 percent upside for Hyundai Motor India, JPMorgan sees the scope for 17 percent more gains in the counter. A pure play on India's passenger vehicle industry, premiumisation, and attractive valuations are some key factors driving the bullish outlook.

items.title: IT stocks shine amid volatility; Bernstein signals growth upcycle led by BFSI, AI-related deals
items.description: Bernstein expects IT growth expectations to be largely led by strengthening order books and reduction in leakages

items.title: CDSL – Valuation full but earnings growth can drive stock upside
items.description: CDSL has posted solid earnings in Q2FY25 and the stock valuation is full. However, MC Pro lists the reasons that can drive further stock upside.

items.title: CG Power shares rise 3% after arm bags order from Chittaranjan Locomotive Works
items.description: The order value is in the range of Rs 500-600 crore, with an execution time frame of one year, CG Power said.

items.title: Netweb Technologies jump 8%, hits fresh all-time high amid heavy volumes
items.description: In the July-September quarter, the company reported a 70 percent year-on-year increase in net profit

items.title: Talbros Automotive skyrockets 15% after bagging Rs 475 crore orders
items.description: Talbros Automotive is expanding its exports to Europe, a specialised market for auto component manufacturers, which is helping to increase its market share in the region and improve overall margins.

items.title: Swiggy| The company is poised to grow with significant demand and expansion| Stock of the day
items.description: Swiggy, now almost a household name across India — particularly in metros and the top 10 cities of the country, has established itself as the second largest company in QC space. Itis a modern technology company offering a user-friendly convenience platform accessible via a unified app. This platform allows users to browse, select, order, and pay for food ("Food Delivery") and groceries and household essentials (“Instamart") with seamless doorstep delivery powered by Swiggy’s on-demand delivery partner network.

items.title: Accumulate Sobha; target of Rs 1802: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: Geojit Financial Services recommended accumulate rating on Sobha with a target price of Rs 1802 in its research report dated November 26, 2024.

items.title: Mid-day Mood | Nifty, Sensex continue lukewarm performance as realty, pharma extend losses
items.description: Most market experts suggest that Maharashtra elections may have set the tone for the current government. Still, the upside remains limited amid a lack of positive triggers in the market.

items.title: InCred equities revises Nifty target, upgrades pharma sector outlook
items.description: The brokerage revised its Nifty target to 25,327 points, citing a delay in RBI's anticipated repo rate cuts and high expectations surrounding second-half earnings growth. The ongoing market correction, which began in September, is expected to persist for several months due to a challenging macroeconomic environment that limits EPS momentum, it  said.

items.title: Why is Pudumjee Industries down 10% in a flattish market?
items.description: Shares of Pudumjee Industries-owned 3P Land Holdings surged to a nearly 17-year high on Tuesday, triggering a wave of profit booking in today's session. The stock's over 123% gains this year provided investors with ample reasons to cash in on their profits.

items.title: Buy CIE Automotive India; target of Rs 578: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: Geojit Financial Services is bullish on CIE Automotive India has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 578 in its research report dated November 26, 2024.

items.description: Geojit Financial Services recommended hold rating on Equitas Small Finance Bank with a target price of Rs 69 in its research report dated November 26, 2024.

items.description: TARC Ishva is located along Golf Course Extension Road in sector 63A of Gurugram

items.title: Vodafone Idea stock rises 6%, extends rally amid buzz of bank guarantee waiver
items.description: This latest policy shift builds on the Cabinet's 2021 reforms, which eliminated the need for guarantees on spectrum acquired prospectively.

items.title: Japanese retail funds start pulling out of India for first time since January 2018
items.description: Since November 2022, $8.6 billion came from Japanese retail funds and $2.1 billion from institutional funds
